name: Mercury
shortDescription: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun.
detailedDescription: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. It is only slightly larger than Earth's Moon.
funFacts: Mercury has wrinkles.
A year on Mercury is just 88 Earth days.
It is the second hottest planet, despite being closest to the Sun.

name: Venus
shortDescription: Venus is the second planet from the Sun.
detailedDescription: Venus is the second planet from the Sun. It is named after the Roman goddess of love and beauty.
funFacts: Venus spins in the opposite direction to most planets.
It is the hottest planet in our solar system.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.

name: Earth
shortDescription: Earth is the third planet from the Sun.
detailedDescription: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life.
funFacts: Earth is the only planet not named after a god.
The Earth is the densest planet in the Solar System.
70% of the Earth's surface is covered in water.

name: Mars
shortDescription: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun.
detailedDescription: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System, being larger than only Mercury.
funFacts: Mars is known as the Red Planet.
Mars has the largest dust storms in the solar system.
Sunsets on Mars are blue.

name: Jupiter
shortDescription: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System.
detailedDescription: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System. It is a gas giant with a mass one-thousandth that of the Sun.
funFacts: Jupiter has the shortest day of all the planets.
The Great Red Spot is a huge storm that has raged for at least 350 years.
Jupiter has a faint ring system.

name: Saturn
shortDescription: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System.
detailedDescription: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. It is a gas giant with an average radius of about nine and a half times that of Earth.
funFacts: Saturn is the flattest planet.
Saturn could float in water because it is mostly gas.
Its rings are made of ice and rock.

name: Uranus
shortDescription: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun.
detailedDescription: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. Its name is a reference to the Greek god of the sky, Uranus, who, according to Greek mythology, was the great-grandfather of Ares (Mars), grandfather of Zeus (Jupiter) and father of Cronus (Saturn).
funFacts: Uranus turns on its axis once every 17 hours, 14 minutes.
It rotates on its side.
Uranus is an Ice Giant.

name: Neptune
shortDescription: Neptune is the eighth and farthest-known Solar planet from the Sun.
detailedDescription: Neptune is the eighth and farthest-known Solar planet from the Sun. In the Solar System, it is the fourth-largest planet by diameter, the third-most-massive planet, and the densest giant planet.
funFacts: Neptune spins on its axis very rapidly.
It has the strongest winds in the solar system.
Neptune is the coldest planet in the Solar System.

name: Pluto
shortDescription: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt.
detailedDescription: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt, a ring of bodies beyond the orbit of Neptune. It was the first and the largest Kuiper belt object to be discovered.
funFacts: Pluto is smaller than USA.
Pluto has a heart shape on its surface.
It was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006.
